intro: Psilanthus viridiflora, commonly known as the green-flowered psilanthus, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Sapindaceae and is characterized by its small, greenish-yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has compound leaves with multiple leaflets and produces small, round fruits that contain several seeds. It is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in moist, shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and understudied species.
